definition: to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
permanent/constant/fixed/usual/ordinary/rule (old)/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷟)
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: The universality of the law of conservation of energy was not generally accepted until 1847.
sentences.chinese: 能量守恆定律的普適性直到1847年纔得到公認。

sentences.english: I have a proof that there are electrodynamic phenomena which violate the law of energy conservation.
sentences.chinese: 我有一個證明，有些是違反了能量守恆定律電動現象。

sentences.english: Is it lost, in violation of the conservation principle?
sentences.chinese: 是違背守恆定律而憑空消失了嗎？

sentences.english: This sweeping generalization is the law of conservation of energy .
sentences.chinese: 這一透徹的概括就是能量守恆定律。

sentences.english: We write it subject to conservation of mass.
Let's try the conservation of mechanical energy.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們試着用機械能，守恆定律解答一下。
